comments.comment: Hi Zingo,
Thank you for your question. Currently, the MacroDock’s macro functionality is only supported on Windows and macOS. However, the docking features (ports, etc.) work on Linux without needing drivers.
We are planning to develop Linux support for the macro functionality in future updates.
Best regards,
MacroDock Team

Hi I just supported your Macrodock, the reason is your quick response to my questions about upgrading Ethernet port to 2.5 gbs and charging port to PD 3.1, even if PD3.1 is not possible for this project, PD 3.0 still acceptable.
I have some observations that I would like the Macrodock team to address and possibly make the change:

1) You have the SD/TF slots on the left side of the dock, can you please move these slots to the right side of the dock. This simple change will make workflow a lot easier to use and inset the SD card into the dock.
2) The video resolution is 8K/30Hz, can you list the resolutions for 6k, 4k, 2k....
3) Since this is your first campaign, can you make the pledge and posted on the top of you campaign page that you Grantee delivery and shipment.
4) can you post a detailed user manual and how to document in pdf format, that is in addition to the small print one that ship with the product.
5) do you have a web site that we can log into for plugin/firmware updates
Lastly this is just a wish list for your future upgraded dock
1) Support of PD3.1
2) Support of USB 4 gen2/TB4 (5). please have at least 2 ports of this type, but also keep a least 2 usb3.2 ports for compatibility purposes
3) Support to DD/TF 4 or 5
4) In my humble opinion, the audio port is somehow absolute, most of the headphones/earbuds now are wireless, BT, you can use this audio port for any other purpose.
5) two hdmi 2.1 port to connection two separate monitors. (you can use the audio port for the second hdmi if you choose to eliminate this audio port for future product.
thanks a lot for listening and responding, Good luck and waiting for your Dock to be delivered on the stated time frame
Hi Magdi,
Thank you for your support and thoughtful feedback. We truly appreciate your suggestions and would like to address them one by one:

1. SD/TF Slot Position: We can certainly consider changing the position of the SD/TF slots. We will conduct a poll after the campaign ends to decide on this modification. We want to respect the majority opinion of our backers.
2. Video Resolution:

3.Delivery and Shipment Commitment: Although this is our first event, we will definitely deliver and transport. Please rest assured that we will clearly display our commitment to delivery and transportation at the top of the event page based on your suggestions.

4. User Manual and Documentation: We will release a detailed user manual and documentation in PDF format, which will be available for download on our website in the future. This will complement the brief manual included with the product.
5. Plugin/Firmware Updates: We are working on building a website where users can log in to access plugin and firmware updates. Our website will be built before the event ends.

We take your suggestions seriously and will consider them for the next generation of MacroDock. This includes the potential for PD3.1 support, USB4 gen2/TB4（5） ports, and additional features like dual HDMI ports and Bluetooth audio solutions.
Thank you once again for your valuable input. We’re excited to bring MacroDock to life, and we’ll be working hard to make the product even better in the future!
Best regards,
MacroDock Team

I also echo the sentiment about the audio jack. Most people are going to be using audio over HDMI, or if using headphones, they're likely to be wireless, and if not, it's not that much bother to plug them into the computer. A second HDMI port would be massively more useful than an audio port. I hope that you will consider this if your designs aren't finalized. I'm willing to bet that myself and OP are far from the only ones who have no use at all for an additional headphone jack, but could definitely use more than a single HDMI out. Even making the second out DisplayPort would be acceptable (though HDMI would be preferred by myself).
Thanks for taking the time to read this, and I'm very excited to receive my MacroDock.
@Kris McCann
Hi Kris,

Thank you so much for your thoughtful suggestion! We truly appreciate your feedback, and we completely understand the desire for an additional HDMI port. We agree that this would be more useful for many users.

For our next generation of products, we’re planning to include an extra HDMI port, and we will definitely keep your input in mind during the design process. Unfortunately, due to production timelines, we won’t be able to make any significant changes for this current generation. However, your feedback is valuable, and we’ll strive to improve in future versions.
Thank you again for sharing your thoughts。
Best regards,
MacroDock Team
